intro: Onosma intermedia, commonly known as the Persian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Onosma intermedia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
